root: ^Hey stranger! So, what do you think? Was it everything you've ever dreamed of?

c-0: ^Guess? Oh, I was hoping you'd find it as exhilirating as I do. Guess we can't all be thrill-seekers.
c-1: ^Aww, come on! It's just a bit of harmless fun with the dearly departed. You're not going to tell me you're scared, are you? You are looking a bit pale...
^I am, so what are you gonna do about it?

c-0: ^Sure, and I'm the Queen of England. Relax, I'll protect you from the scary old bones. So, tell me, what did you find?!
c-1: ^Sure, and I'm the Queen of England. Relax, I'll protect you from the scary old bones. So, come on, what did you find?!

c-2: ^Duh, that's what I've been saying. And those bones.. there's something eerily beautiful about them, don't you think?

c-0: ^Oh, don't give me that look. I can appreciate the aesthetics of a well-aged skeleton, can't I?
^Woah, dude! You're totally coming for my graverobbing throne here. Should I be worried? That's the best find in probably years!
^Wait.. You've been doing this for years?

^Did I say years? Slip of the tongue. But yeah, it's been a while. This cemetery is almost like a second home. Weird, right? There's just something comforting about the quiet. So, dazzle me again, what else did you unearth?
c-1: ^Oh, I love the competetive spirit! But hold on, don't get too cocky, rookie. Let's see if your luck holds out. What else did you find?

c-0: ^What the hell! Seriously? The grave I was poking around in just had a pair of dirty socks and a used condom. Were you...?
^You dirty bastard. I knew it, Saltburn all the way. Kidding! I totally had you for a second. A diamond ring and a ruby? You're either incredibly lucky or cursed. What else did you find?
c-1: ^That's the spirit. What's the harm? They've been dead for decades. Let's see, what else did you manage to dig up?

c-0: ^Seriously, you're making a killing tonight! Here I was thinking I waas the seasond pro, and you came along turning everything upside down.
^Definitely, though at this rate, I might start wondering if satan had something to do with it. I should bring you along more often. Got anything else, or are you hoarding all the luck tonight?
c-1: ^Look at you, fortune teller! Let's see if your winning streak is going to hold up at the last find. Spill the beans, what's next?

c-0: ^Okay, at this point, I'm just pissed. You've officially outdone me on my own turf. How are you even doing this? Did you sacrifice a baby earlier today?
^Keep that up, and you'll need to start giving me pointers.
c-1: ^Luck, nothing. Don't downplay your skills. They're obviously paying off, big time!

ENDING: ^Can we really keep this stuff? It feels wrong..
^This is incredible! I can't believe I found all this!

c-1: ^I know, right? Totally worth the creepy factor. Now, imagine what we could do on future dates? The opportunities are endelss!

c-0: ^Me too! This was so much fun. I really enjoyed your sense of adventure and that you came here with an open mind. I had a great night.
^Sure, and I'm the Queen of England. Relax, I'll protect you from the scary old bones. So, come on, what did you find?!

g-0: ^Shouldn't we put it back? It seems disrespectful..

c-2: ^Disrespectful? Those bones have been lying there for centuries. They won't miss a few trinkets. Don't be such a bummer.

c-0: ^Oh, don't give me that look. I can appreciate the aesthetics of a well-aged skeleton, can't I?
